definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: On that occasion, it ultimately didn't damage our championship dream.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候的平局终究没有影响我们夺标的梦想。

sentences.english: How the management risk that countervail low hold the belt brings.
sentences.chinese: 如何抵销低价夺标带来的经营风险。

sentences.english: Teams from five universities battled for the prize in the basketball match.
sentences.chinese: 来自五所大学的篮球队为夺标而展开了争夺战。

sentences.english: The team is a serious contender for the title this year.
sentences.chinese: 该队是今年不可轻视的夺标竞争对手。

definition: to win the top award/to come first in the examination rankings
to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
to win the laurels/to pass an imperial examination/to win a championship
to defend the crown (in sports championship)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to win a championship/to come out top/to take the cup
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
